overview:
Ashli Norton is the co-founder of the small, highly acclaimed web/mobile app shop SimpleLeap Software and new mobile game company Fine & Dandy Games.

She was born and raised in Atlanta, GA, got suspended from school frequently for selling candy and CDs out of her backpack in high school, and afterwards quit attending college after she realized a degree was pointless to her and she was being taught what ‘they’ expected her to learn (even after earning a decent GPA).

Before dropping out of college, Ashli dabbled in web design and web app creation and in 2004 tried to take on the phone book by developing a website called Wuraweb that would help people find service providers, get their ratings, and prices all online.

After Wuraweb’s failure, Ashli went on to create a few more startups and finally found a bit of success in 2008 with the launch of a study app called Cram on the BlackBerry. Cram was later launched on the Mac and iPhone as was a top app in the education category receiving recognition by Apple as an ‘Staff Pick’ on multiple occasions.

Ashli has recently released SimpleLeap Software’s first web app Workitywork, an app that helps create a happier workplace and has moved to the San Francisco bay area in attempt to make the world a better place with apps.
